Review title: If you love shark attack films, see this on the big screen
Review_body: The Shallows has the most realistic looking shark out of any shark film I've watched. The tension builds up nicely throughout and every time the shark shows up is a treat. The only reservation that I have with this film is the end is a little silly. However you really have to suspend belief when it comes to any film that's based completely around a shark attacking people. They are always going to be unrealistic. Bottom line: The shark is awesome, hopefully this movie being successful at the box office will give way to more heavily plot based shark films; where the shark looks just as real as the one seen here. 10/10 for being the only entertaining shark film since Deep Blue Sea.

Review title: I did not enjoy this movie
Review_body: Although Blake Lively looks amazing in her bikini. There were too many body shots of her during the entire movie. I am not a prude by all means, but how many butt shots do we need to see to get the idea? With so few characters it gets boring with her moaning and grunting during the whole movie. It was like the movie with Robert Redford where he was the only person in the movie and all he did was moan and grunt, that also was a horrible movie in my opinion. It starts out really slow and there are several suspenseful moments, overall it was just dumb. It has not comparison to the 1st jaws movie. I honestly couldn't wait till it was over. A bit ridiculous if you ask me. Her performance in Age of Adeline was awesome.

Review title: Another open water movie that never ends
Review_body: How this movie got 7 out of 10 stars is beyond me,the scenery was nice, but it was worse then open water and about as boring and drawned out that it could possibly get. Basically it contained 4 characters which all die but one person of course we know who didn't die. The ending was even worse when she kills the shark by guiding it to its death when it gets stabbed by the buoy pipes. I had waited a while to see this movie and was really disappointed, at one point the two guys come back and she is screaming shark, shes on the rocks and they ignore her, morons get in the water and soon enough are eaten. So then we are subjected to blake talking to a seagull and timing the swim, evidentally she knows the sharks swimming routine.I have really nothing more to say but have to keep writing because of the limit, let's just say I wasted 1.5 hrs of my life to route for a shark

Review title: Best movie experience for me so far this year !!
Review_body: I am not here to review movies or dissect it and say good and bad. Over all I feel in love with this movie experience. So far this year had seen most of the releases of big banners, superheros etc and was not this much glued to the screen as this movie was. Blake Lively kept the movie lively with her looks and acting. The shark was not just haunting but just kept the pace of movie well, the beech was paradise and very less characters involved made the movie so neat execution. Over all I wanna say a good movie experience. Must watch. This is the first time am posting a review and I compelled myself to do it.

This move is a gem!! The Shallows is able to create a very tense and frightening atmosphere, worrying when the shark will appear and threaten the main character. The suspense in this movie is beyond amazing and there is a constant sense of urgency and danger as well. The main character's life is always hanging in the balance and you never know if, or when, she will die. The lead is very likable as well, making you want to root for her, even creating a very cute and funny relationship with a bird. The camera shots are also gorgeous as well. The water and surrounding land is captured beauteously. Yet, the emptiness of the water creates a very unnerving feel and the placements of the few set pieces is unbelievable. Their is also a very strong theme of self-empowerment and finding courage in yourself. The movie is also able to jerk a few tears, which I did not expect. My only critics would be the slow start and weak backstory for the lead role. But, after the beginning sequence, I never left the edge of my seat. I would definitely recommend The Shallows to anyone and everyone!! I love this movie!

Review title: Easily One of the Best Shark Movies Ever Made!!
Review_body: This film is completely worth seeing on all formats! It's an exceptional order of events, but totally believable. It will keep you engaged the whole time, and not in laughter or ridiculousness. No hot shot directors here with overgrown Kung-Fu sharks doing otherworldly things... no. This film looks real and is beautifully shot. Blake does a fine piece of acting, and the shark appears quite realistic. We need more of this type of filming. Thanks to the director for sticking to reality, because I'm sick of so many directors who've lost touch with the real world and getting facts straight. (ex: Mission Impossible 2... people jousting on motorbikes and leaping off of them to collide in mid-air?...absolutely awful!) If you love sharks, go see this movie because it's great!

Review title: wish i hadn't seen it, then i wouldn't have to relive it while reviewing it. all of this could have been avoided if someone had told me to never watch this.
Review_body: i think i'm fortunate in that i'm not familiar with Blakey Lively so my view of this film wasn't influenced by her image. i will reiterate what a previous reviewer said and with it, justify my 2 out of 10 rating when he said " god dam she look hot in a bikini." i hate to admit it, but slogged through this whole film thinking it could only be redeemed if she somehow lost her top. but frankly, that's all this movie has going for it. look out, spoilers inc.everything about this film is terrible. from the beginning opening scene to the final credits (i sat through it -all-) it was if i was watching a college film project made by an ambitious stoner, his entourage of two stoner buddies, his hot girlfriend, a neighborhood kid and a venice pier trained seagull.i'm convinced the people who compare this to Jaws in any fashion have never even seen Jaws or are somehow mistakenly thinking of Jaws the Revenge in which case i'll remind you that it's the one with Mario Van Peebles in it. the really terrible one.Soul Surfer is a better shark movie. Finding Nemo is a better shark movie. Little Mermaid is a better shark movie.this movie is just crap. the CG is well overdone and it seems the animation crew shared the same enthusiasm and skill you'd expect from a senior citizen inserting their 3.5" floppy disc, discovering the dial up glory of AOL online and creating their first Myspace page complete with "can't smile without you" MIDI soundtrack. temporary suspension of disbelief is required if you want to believe a shark is more interested in a struggling, hot blond than 2 tons of dead whale protein.complete disregard for the physics of tides if you want to believe that one minute you're catching rolling 8 foot waves with your bros in the surf and 10 seconds later, are chilling with your homies in glass calm water well past the surf break.it doesn't end. the ominous unnamed beach. the seagull. the go pro (and suddenly unattached helmet). the tide. the belief that nature ignores tides. and that buoy. just please, please don't watch this film.

Review title: Exactly what you want from a Shark film!
Review_body: From the very first time you see Nancy (Blake Lively) enter the water you are always looking around the water surrounding her expecting the Shark. The director has done some incredible work with the scenery and cinematography of this film.Blake Lively is great in this film considering she had to carry the majority of the screen time and the way she acts with the shark is great considering the shark was CGI. Her acting and use of body language really gives you the feeling of fear and you put yourself into her position and this film makes you think about what you would do in this situation.As far as the shark goes this is a brilliant, realistic shark that you really do feel is in the water surrounding Nancy. Not too big to be unrealistic but not to small to reduce the fear factor. Everything about the shark is great. The director gives the shark a personality of its own and it has different situations to act to.This film does a great job of balancing the gore, reality, characters personalities, attacks and for a film that is on for under 90 minutes, it keeps you on the edge of your seat for around 70 of those minutes.Only downsides would be that i would've liked to have seen more of the shark from a personal point of view because there is a good enough build up to expect a lot more shark screen time however all said and done an outstanding film that many can't fault and I would love to see another one like this very soon.

Oh dear! Started off moderately OK, though you'd have to question the sanity of any girl wearing not-too-much taking a lift from a guy she doesn't know in Mexico.....down a deserted track, to a deserted beach. Then the guys she meets down there don't think to offer to wait for her, even though she has no way to get back! Then the way she eventually deals with the shark is ridiculous beyond belief. How lucky for her the child found the Go-pro, knew how to work it, & realised where it came from, all in time for the good Samaritan to save her.....what a happy ending. Shame it's so pathetically improbable for anyone who has even a modicum of experience of how things work in the real world. A joke!

Review title: Really annoying film that is let down in so many ways.
Review_body: I had high hopes when i saw the trailer but the film is flawed throughout and in the end become utterly silly. One of the most annoying part was the sea. When you want spectacular surfing shots the waves are huge. When you want dialogue the sea is suddenly like a mill pond, its ridiculous.Other surfers don't spot a huge dead whale, not sure how as the water is very calm. As for the shark, its a joke. I wish they had gone more realistic instead of making it plain stupid. The jumping out of the water or the fire scene are laughable. And don't get me started on the seagull, what were they thinking.I guess if you ignore the massive errors by the director then the actress is good and the location is beautiful...wait for DVD. (and then only on a rainy day)

I wanted to like this movie. I really did, but its just bad.Basically we have a hot blond chick that gets stranded on a rock with a shark trying to get her.Now here's the biggest flaw in the movie. There is a 2 ton whale that is barely eaten in the same location as this girl. So why is the shark interested in a 90lb woman over a 2 ton whale? Oh not only is this shark after this woman, this shark attempts to climb rocks, go through jellyfish, tries to climb its way through a buoy drone and basically stalk this girl for like two days when it has a nice huge whale right there? That made no sense at all.The next issue is the woman is apparently a superhero since she can suffer massive blood lost, jellyfish stings, dehydration, concussions and yet still swim like an Olympic swimmer by out swimming a great white shark.C'mon.

Review title: I'm not sure this was the same movie that some people reviewed
Review_body: The performances weren't terrible and the idea behind the story is a good one. But WAY too much suspension of disbelief required to enjoy this... A giant shark somehow has grudge about Blake Lively to the point where it will ignore the whale carcass just so it can eat her specifically.Meh...A lot of shots that seem to focus on the fact that Blake has boobs. Don't get me wrong they're nice boobs, but seriously?It kind of annoyed me because this film could have been so much more with a bit more work to the story like.

This movie was terrible and is a complete waste of time. There is absolutely no action or thrill to it. About 95% of the movie is literally of Blake Lively on a rock "whining" in unrealistic pain. She would be hurting, barely could move her leg one second and then suddenly can swim just fine the next. Not to mention, swimming away extremely fast from a great white shark. Yep, totally believable. I love Blake Lively as an actress but her performance was comical because parts were so ridiculously exaggerated. There's a scene where she's been on the rock for no more than two hours and she's "starving" and attempts to eat a live crab and then spits it out. Another social dynamic is of her and this relationship with an injured seagull, symbolizing their mutually crappy situation together. However,it was as though the director was trying to create the same kind of survival relationship that Tom Hanks had with his volleyball, 'Wilson," in Castaway but totally failed. Let me mention the shark attacks. There were none. Seriously, there was before the shark was going to attack and after. There were no actual scenes of the shark actually attacking someone, aside from the one scene that they showed on the trailer that made the whole movie look like it was actually going to be an intense thriller. Did they run out of money for special effects? Every shark movie is made with the intent to scare you, everything after the Jaws series has been a joke and this one takes the cake.

Review title: Everything is wrong with this movie
Review_body: Nothing is right! The girl survives with deep wounds for days with no food or water, the shark's behavior is all but natural (great whites are specialist hunters, not opportunistic ones like the bull shark), the way the shark dies (ridiculous), the water going on fire (wtf?...), the girl swimming among jellyfishes, being stung and apparently not too affected by them, the float leaning to the side (did the shark manage to change its center of gravity?), the waves on demand (one minute the see is flat and the next minute she starts surfing beautiful waves), etc... I can't see anything right at all. Worst piece of crap I've seen in a long long time!

This was a brilliant movie. If you're looking for a literal, slasher, gory shark attack film, this isn't for you. This is a thought provoking masterpiece of writing and directing. It is a metaphor for loss, struggle, fight, triumph, and continuing. Here's what the story is NOT about: the story is not about a girl and a shark, it is not a story about a man's (woman's) struggle against nature, well it is kinda, but the story is centrally focused on man's (woman's) struggle against self. The story begins with a woman struggling against a terrible tragedy that she is unable to get over. She is running from her pain and her life because she's lost a sense of purpose and direction. The shark... bare with me here... is about cancer. A HUGE, aggressive, pitiless killer that is relentless and merciless. The story is about the value of the FIGHT. We fight, not for ourselves, but for those that we love. We fight for a purpose, for love, regardless of the outcome. You don't know what's going to happen, but you fight anyway because it's there and it won't let you go. The ending is especially poignant when Nancy says, "I'm okay". She's referring to herself, her grief, the loss of her mother, not just surviving a shark attack. And, a year later, even more powerfully, she gets back in the water, because life continues, even past the grief, the pain, the loss. This movie is poetry. It's romantic. It's Old Man and the Sea as a shark attack movie. Watch this movie again with an eye for the romantic and you may see the power in the writing, directing, and acting. Beautiful. Absolutely beautiful. Immediately one of my favorite movies of all time.

Review title: Horrible. You'd have a better time taking a crap.
Review_body: The first 20 minutes was extremely boring and overly sexualized. All I found out about the actress was that she liked showing off her body to the camera, and that she quit med school. Sounds like a winner already. She attempts to seem like that was not a life altering decision by avoiding the subject. After watching 10 minutes of the film nothing was happening. The main thing displayed was her swimming most of the time and talking on the phone to her family. Very boring and uninteresting beginning. Relates very well to Twilight where most of the movie has little dialogue and large amounts of awkward body language/music. Honestly would have enjoyed those 20 minutes more sitting on the toilet scrolling through reddit.

Loved this movie! It was such a cool moment to spot our earrings on Blake's character. We now know that jewelry can double as a survival kit! It's not your typical shark film and it is filled with a lot of anxiety-inducing scenes. Really intense movie with a stellar performance by Blake Lively. Every character served their purpose in piecing together the story, including the bird! It's a good movie to watch with the family or with your significant other. Blake is one of my favorite actresses so this movie comes highly recommended! She is able to carry the movie even though there are some scenes with a few different characters. Love, JLANI Jewels

Review title: It is the best movie in 2016 and so underrated
Review_body: I have to say this movie is so underrated, it is way better than many movies which rated above 7 marks here. Why? It is because it has a really completed script, it is simple and meaningful. The relationships between the main character and her families, her friends, her life and the nature, are so beautifully combined together. Yes it is a survival movie, however it has more meaning behind those struggles and the ways to solve them. Although parts of the film you might find that were similar to JAWS, according to the story telling method, but you will see there are new elements and creative details as well. 2016 was not a good year of movie (just on my personal opinion), this movie is the one that you should never miss!

Review title: It's different from others shark movie
Review_body: It's like jaws and cast away combined together. Great plot and scenery

Just watched The Shallows and I'm in love. This was a creative survival film, I highly recommend watching it. The thriller aspect was well done, the attacks and "gore" was tasteful, the make up team was magnificent as well as the amount of research done on the film. The CGI shark is BEAUTIFUL its hard to believe she's not real. Blake Lively deserves an award for her performance, her acting was was natural, compassionate and realistic and made me want to see her character triumph. Not only was the film well written it was cinematically gorgeous. Full of creativity, beauty and thrill this film as become one of my new favorites. It's not "just another Shark movie."

Review title: Not my favorite but i've seen worse
Review_body: It was an OK movie. There were some parts of the movie I really liked, but there were also some parts that I didn't understand and that I didn't like. Some things that I really liked about this movie is how good the acting was, also how real everything looked. The shark and the bird look like real animals. Sometimes in movies it's very obvious that there is a green screen, but the technology here was just amazing. I was pretty entertained throughout the whole movie because of the shark. It was so ridiculous you just kept wondering what insane things it was going to do next. I'm no shark expert, but i'm pretty sure sharks don't jump onto little rock islands, jump out of the water to bite the top of a buoy to get the girl into the water, or run into a dying whale a couple of times to knock the girl off into the water so it could eat her. Why would a shark spend so much time stalking a girl to eat when there was a fresh whale carcass just a couple of yards away they it could eat with no effort. Another thing I didn't like about the movie is how predictable it was for me. Every time I saw a new person on the beach, I knew they were going to get into the water and die. I also knew that the main character, Nancy, wasn't going to die. I knew this because there really weren't any other main characters in the movie so how would they finish the movie if she was dead? I think one of the biggest things I took from this movie, is don't go places alone. Bad things always happen when you go out on big adventures alone. If you ever get into trouble like Nancy did and you have someone with you, you can get help faster. So always travel with a buddy.
Tense and gripping, Jaws this is not. But despite that I found I couldn't take my eyes off it. Pretty darned good stuff.
The acting and filming isn't too bad, but the entire concept, story, execution and climax was preposterously stupid.

Why is the shark so focuses on killing her. I never seen a movie were a shark is so dead set on killing one person. It would make more sense if she did something to the shark. And the only people around doesnt speak her language and there are on 8 people in the whole movie.

Every stupid thing you can possibly do in that situation, she does. And she's supposed to be the smart one!?
3 stars because I managed to watch it to the end
